required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Study of Patients With Leukemia Relapse in the CNS Treated With CAR T Cells
clinical_study.official_title: CARs for CNS-Leukemia Relapse: A Retrospective International Study

brief_summary.textblock:
CAR T cells targeting CD19 have been approved for patients with relapsed or refractory ALL, failing two or more prior protocols. Several institutional-based studies with other CAR T cells targeting CD19 have demonstrated outstanding response rates in patients with refractory disease, and the ability of CAR T cells to clear CNS leukemia. Nevertheless, these cases are sparse and have never been reported collectively.
Here, we aim to retrospectively assess toxicity and long term outcome of patients treated with CAR T cells for CNS relapse of ALL.

primary_outcome.description: Duration between CAR T-cell infusion and death or last follow-up, according to Kaplan-Meier analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of CAR-related CRS or ICANS per ASCTC guidelines
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients and average grade of cytokine-release syndrome and immune-effector cell associated neurotoxicity syndrome within 2 months after CAR treatment, according to ASCTC guidelines (Lee et al, BBMT 2019)
Duration between CAR T-cell infusion and leukemia relapse, according to Kaplan-Meier analysis
Duration between CAR T-cell infusion and CNS leukemia relapse, according to Kaplan-Meier analysis

arm_group.description: Patients with active CNS leukemia at the time of lymphodepletion
Patients who were referred to CAR T-cells with CNS disease, which was cleared by the time of lymphodepletion

study_pop.textblock: Retrospective review of patients with CNS - involvement of B-cell ALL, treated with CAR T cells targeting CD19 of either an institutional-based clinical trial, a pharma-based clinical trial or commercial product.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Prior diagnosis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia involving the central nervous system
- Treatment with CAR T cells (either on a clinical trial or commercial use) due to this indication
